children.title: John Roberts Criticized Supreme Court Confirmation Process, Before There Was a Vacancy
children.abstract: Ten days before Justice Antonin Scalia died, Chief Justice Roberts said that the Senate should ensure that nominees are qualified, and leave politics out of it.

children.title: Brussels Airport and Subway Explosions Kill 34
children.abstract: The Belgian capital was in a state of virtual lockdown after the blasts, which occurred four days after the capture of a suspect in the Nov. 13 Paris attacks.

children.title: The Man the Founders Feared
children.abstract: Make no mistake. Donald Trump is an advocate of political violence.

children.title: Most Republicans Feel Embarrassed by Campaign, Poll Says
children.abstract: A majority of Republican primary voters view their party as divided, while Democratic voters see their side as unified, according to a New York Times/CBS News national poll.

children.title: U.S. Says It May Not Need Apple’s Help to Unlock iPhone
children.abstract: A court hearing set for Tuesday was canceled in the Justice Department’s bid to gain access to phone data in the San Bernardino mass shooting inquiry.

children.title: The Mutual Dependence of Donald Trump and the News Media
children.abstract: While Mr. Trump’s presidential bid benefits from constant coverage, that coverage is also a lifeline to news outlets as they jockey for survival.

children.title: Cuba Meeting Between Obama and Castro Exposes Old Grievances
children.abstract: During an extraordinary news conference, the leaders’ exchanges underscored how far the two nations have to travel to fully restore relations.

children.title: What Happens When Millennials Run the Workplace?
children.abstract: At Mic, a media site created by and for 20-somethings, oversharing, acting entitled and second-guessing the boss are the norm.

children.title: ‘The Passion’: Jesus’ Final Hours as a Halftime Show
children.abstract: On the seventh day, Fox didn’t rest. It took the greatest story ever told and turned it into something that at times recalled a shopping mall grand opening.

children.title: Boaty McBoatface: What You Get When You Let the Internet Decide
children.abstract: A proposal by a British agency to let the Internet name a research ship is the latest in a trend of web users having some fun with public polls.

children.title: Cubans Pack the Streets for a Glimpse of President Obama
children.abstract: The president’s visit, the first by an American leader in nearly nine decades, holds the potential to exorcise one of the last ghosts of the Cold War.

children.title: Stay or Go? Cuban Entrepreneurs Divided on Where to Stake Futures
children.abstract: While many leave for the United States, business owners opting to remain are creating an expanding class, optimistic despite serious challenges.

children.title: Republican Leaders Map a Strategy to Derail Donald Trump
children.abstract: If aggressive efforts to deny Mr. Trump the presidential nomination fail, the party leaders say they will try to field an independent candidate for the general election.

children.title: Florida Town Curbs Debauchery, and Pays the Price
children.abstract: Panama City Beach, stung from the party-hard reputation it has gained, is now finding that a move to tone things down might have been bad for business.

children.title: 2016 Delegate Count and Primary Results
children.abstract: The 2016 primaries and caucuses have begun. See results and upcoming primary dates.

children.title: After Funeral and Cremation, a Shock: The Woman in the Coffin Wasn’t Mom
children.abstract: Val-Jean McDonald’s sons are struggling to grasp how they could have said their last goodbyes to a stranger dressed in their mother’s clothes.

children.title: Cuba on the Edge of Change
children.abstract: Photographs from a land of endless waiting and palpable erosion — but also, an uncanny openness among everyday people.

children.title: As Obama Arrives, Cuba Tightens Grip on Dissent
children.abstract: Cuba, a police state working out how much to open up to the world and to its own people, has gone above and beyond to prevent embarrassing surprises.

children.title: Why the Republican Establishment Doesn’t Like John Kasich
children.abstract: The Ohio governor’s only path to the nomination runs through the party’s convention — where he may get a cool reception.

children.title: On Invincible Ignorance
children.abstract: The Republican Party may be in for some soul-searching, but so far its leaders remain in denial.
